title: please help
body: so i recently had an update on my computer and after it updated my settings were changed in game and now when i have the resolution set to my monitor size it feels zoomed in and there isn't zooming out but the only option to make it not feels zoomed in doesn't properly fit my screen does anyone know what might have caused this or how to fix it because at the moment the game feels completely unplayable and after many years and quite a bit of money on the game i don't want to have to stop playing because of something like this

replies.body:
It sounds like a Windows update may have borked your Windows display resolution. I suggest following [**these steps**](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/4910-screen-resolution-display-change-windows-10-a.html) to ensure your display is configured properly in Windows before you hop into a custom match and configure your League resolution settings to match the Windows setting. Be sure you set your Windows resolution to whatever Windows recommends.

Let me know if this caused any noticeable change.
out of curiosity do you know why when i do a 1768 x 992 and it looks exactly like a 1024 x 768 and why it ruins all text on the screen

I'm not quite sure, but we've had some players report issues with 1768x992 when using a TV as a display. For some reason, some newer Windows 10 updates have caused some TV displays to not work properly with a number of games, including League.

must be whats happening with me as well then cause in my match history i had two games the same day one was fine then i went to bed and when i woke up my computer had updated and then it stopped working thanks for offering what you could really hope this can be fixed soon i would like to be able to paly again without having to purchase a new monitor

While that specific resolution may not be functioning properly right now, I'm confident that if we escalate this to our tech team, we'll be able to find a resolution that will work for you. I recommend running some system logs with our [**HRT Application**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367), then attach them to a [**support ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so we can get back to you.

If you run into any issues with this, let me know.
its a bit late but when reading what it does it doesnt seem to see any problems at all
Are you talking about the Hextech Repair Tool? If so, it's not supposed to see problems in this case, it's meant to grab system logs for you so you can attach them to your ticket. ^.^
